Speaker: Police Dispatch
Text: All units, level four mobilisation. Location--Fisk Tower.

Speaker: Peter
Text: Fisk?

Speaker: Police Dispatch
Text: SWAT is 10-84 at Fisk Tower. All units standby, warrant is en route.
[Spidey puts on a mask and jumps out the window. He calls Yuri Watanabe on the way.]

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Captain Watanabe.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Did you take him?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: No. We’re at Fisk Tower, but still waiting on the warrant.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Mind if I join in on the fun?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: You know how his lawyers are… this one needs to go by the book.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: C’mon Yuri, I’ve been waiting eight years for this.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: You really want to help? Head to Times Square, sounds like his guys are trying to keep my backup from reaching the scene…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: You got it - almost there!
[Spidey gets another call.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hello?

Speaker: Boss
Text: Parker? Where are you? We must run through the demonstration at least once before the grant committee arrives.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Uhh, yes. Sorry. Yes. Dealing with a… personal issue. I’ll be in soon. Promise.  Eesh, better wrap this up quick, then get to my *real* job.  Looks like Yuri called in the cavalry.
Action: (hangs up) (sees a lot of police cars)

Text: [Spidey follows the police cars and arrives at the scene of the shootout.]

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: We need more backup!

Speaker: Police Officer 2
Text: 10-32. Times Square. Officers under fire!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Bring in the hammer.

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: *MOVE!*

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Get him!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Morning guys! Who’s ready for their hot fresh cup of bodily harm?

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: I’m in an ass-kickin’ mood.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: You’ll regret that.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Teach him a lesson.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: You’re mine!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: This doesn’t look good.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Somebody just shoot him!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: We can’t let him beat us!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Take him out.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: You want some?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Spider-Man, what’s your status?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Almost done here. You?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: We’re about to go in.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Be there soon. Can’t wait to see Willie’s face when you slap the cuffs on him. Okay, Yuri, all done. What’s happen--  Yuri?! I knew Fisk wouldn’t go quietly.
[Spidey swings to the Fisk Tower.]

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Get more backup! And lock down the airspace.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yuri, you okay?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: If he makes it out of the building we’re gonna lose him.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I’m gonna go, uh…

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Do your thing.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yes! Today’s the day, Willie.
[Spidey jumps to the building and fight with Fisk’s thugs.]

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Take him out!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: C’mon, c’mon-- keep shooting!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Heads up! Hey, where you going? Catch! I’ll clear a path, follow me!

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: Get outta here, Spider-Man, we got this!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Quit lettin’ him get airborne!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Sorry to break it to you, but you do NOT got this, buddy.

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: What’s Spider-Man doing here-- he’s gonna mess everything up!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Thanks for the confidence boost, guys!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Start praying.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Get ‘im!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I guess this is what they call a hostile workplace.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Enough already!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Come on, he’s one guy!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: He got Davey!
[Spidey defeats all the thugs, but soon the new ones appear on the upper floors and start shooting at the policemen.]

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: Down, down, down!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Gotta take those shooters out.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: You shouldn’t’ve messed with the Kingpin.
[SWAT are trying to take the elevator.]

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: C’mon, c’mon! They shut the elevators down! Take the stairs!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I prefer a more direct approach.
[He opens elevator shaft and crawls up.]

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe (on the phone)
Text: Spider-Man, status?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Heading to the upper floors-- and hoping nobody turns on the elevators…

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Our choppers are taking fire, looks like Fisk has armed men on every floor.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: He’s desperate…

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: …and he’s hitting us with everything he’s got.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I have to find him and end this.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Not yet. We just picked up chatter – they’re wiping all their data servers. We need that evidence if we want to put him away for good.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Okay, server room it is. Call from May. Better answer. Uh… hi Aunt May.

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: What is all that noise?!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Watching a Super Hero movie. What’s up?

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: I just wanted make sure we were still on for dinner tomorrow night.

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: Hostiles, next floor up!

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: Okay, love you.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Love you too.
[He gets to the upper floor.]

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Get ready for some pain.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Get out of the way!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Box him in!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Hold him, so he can’t jump around!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: How exactly do you think this ends well for you?

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Get ‘im.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Bring him down already!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: On to the next one. Regret your life choices yet?

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Knock him out!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Gotta find that server room before there’s no evidence left. If I go in this way they’ll destroy all the evidence. I should look for a sneaky way in. There we go.  It’s like my own private entrance. Fisk may be a dirty criminal, but he has remarkably clean air vents.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Hurry up! The boss wants everything erased!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: I can’t make it delete any faster.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: They’re so cute when they’re oblivious.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: How’s it coming?

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Halfway there. Just need another minute or two.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: You think the cops know where we are?

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Don’t worry about out there. Worry about in here.
[Spidey jumps into server room filled with thugs.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Is this tech support? I forgot my password.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Spider-Man!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Don’t let him near the console!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Rush ‘im!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Hold him back!

Speaker: Automated Voice
Text: Warning. Full deletion imminent.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Stall him! The system’s still purging!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: And I thought the IT guys at my last job were rude.
[After defeating all the thugs Spidey runs up to the computer.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Gotta access that console before everything’s gone. Let’s see just how good their security is. Oh you guys forgot the latest kernel patch, tsk-tsk…
[Wilson Fisk’s face appears on a huge screen.]

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: Hiding in the server room? Cowardly… even for you.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Says the guy frantically erasing his search history.

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: After all these years, you’re still just an ignorant child…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: True, but that’s part of my charm, isn’t it?

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: Damn you. Get that door down, now!
[A lot of bandits rush into the room.]

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: Get past him! Destroy everything! Look around you! I did this! What have you ever done that mattered?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Well, there was that time I took down a pompous, overstuffed crime lord before breakfast.

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: Without me, the scum I kept in check will run rampant. And it’ll be your fault.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Been a long, tough road, Fisk. Almost sad to see it end.

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: Mere prelude.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Well, get ready for the main event.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Enough talking!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yuri, an explosion just --

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Fisk could have the whole place wired. I’m sending in a bomb unit.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I’ll make sure no one gets in their way.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Don’t let him get you airborne!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Not a chance in hell, buddy.
[SWAT break into the floor.]

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: It’s clear, move up!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hey guys! I guess bombs are part of Willie’s getaway plan.

Speaker: Woman
Text: AAHH! Help!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Sounds like they’re trapped…

Speaker: Bomb Squad Officer
Text: You go after them, we’ll look for the bombs.

Speaker: Man
Text: HELP! SOMEBODY!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Everyone clear out! Evacuate the building!

Speaker: Woman
Text: I heard more people back that way!

Speaker: Another Woman
Text: Spider-Man! We can’t move, we’re pinned down!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I’ll lift it. When you’re free, get out, fast. If you can walk, help the injured. Got it?
[Spidey lifts the support beam.]

Speaker: Woman
Text: Y-yes.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Go, go, go!

Speaker: Woman
Text: Thank you! He did it! Let’s go!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Okay Willie, comin’ your way.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Spider-Man, it’s Yuri.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: How we doing, Captain?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Could be better. Our choppers took a beating-- we just had to ground our last one. If Fisk calls in a chopper, we have no one to stop it from landing.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: And no one to chase him if he flies away…

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Why do I get the feeling that’s what he was planning all along?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Because he probably was. Damn. Yuri, get EMTs up here-- fast!

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: We’re trying.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Uh-oh-- INCOMING!  That’s enough out of you… More rockets? Little excessive don’t you think?

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: This is gonna hurt.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: I hate this guy.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: What--? Is it national rocket day or something? Gotcha. Man, how’d the bomb squad guys get through this?

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: He’s here!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Get ‘im!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Settle down, I’ve got enough for everybody.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: What are we supposed to do against that?!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Not a chance in hell, buddy.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Okay, room is clear. Bomb squad must be somewhere ahead hope they’re okay.
[He goes into next room and find the squad.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: You guys all right?

Speaker: Bomb Squad Officer
Text: We were just about to call for backup.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I think I’m it.

Speaker: Bomb Squad Officer
Text: Lead the way, we’ll be right behind you.

Speaker: Bomb Squad Officer 2
Text: Heads up, boss…
[They aim the guns at Spidey. He senses it.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: You guys were in bed with Fisk all along? Aww, now I’ll never get that image out of my head!

Speaker: Bomb Squad Officer
Text: Get him!

Speaker: Bomb Squad Officer
Text: Take him out!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: So your plan didn’t work. On to plan B-- getting kicked in the face.

Speaker: Bomb Squad Officer
Text: We can’t let him get into the office!

Speaker: Bomb Squad Officer
Text: Just shoot him already!
[After dealing with the squad Spidey calls Yuri.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hey Yuri. Looks like some of your guys were on Fisk’s payroll. Good news is, they were Willie’s last line of defense. I’m right outside his office.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Take him down. Now.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: With pleasure.
[He goes in and sees Fisk at his table.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Writing your memoirs? Don’t forget the hyphen between “Spider” and “Man.”

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: Get the chopper ready. I won’t be long.  I’m surprised you made it this far. But your foolishness ends now.
[He enters a special room and closes the thick glass door behind him.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Uh… you do know I can still see you, right?

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: Eight years of this insolence…
[Two automatic turrets appear in the room.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: For me? You shouldn’t have…
[Epic fight begins.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Gotta wait for an opening. It’s reloading. Okay, *now*! Now’s my chance.

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: What are you doing?!  How is this happening?!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: What’s wrong, Willie? You seem angry…

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: I will DESTROY you!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Take your best shot. That gave me an opening.

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: You’re out of your depth, boy!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Not this time…

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: Tiresome annoyance!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hang in there… it’ll be over soon.

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: You are everything that’s wrong with this city!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Huh. I was gonna say the same to you.

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: You know what to do, men.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Surround him!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Everyone. ENGAGE!

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: You fools! You are trained to fight, so FIGHT!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Bring him to the ground!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: You got this coming.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Spread out!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Time to end this.

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: I don’t want excuses! What do I pay you for?!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Protect the boss!

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: NO! I can handle myself. Imbeciles! You’ll die as uselessly as you lived.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Take your best shot.

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: Where are the reinforcements!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: I don’t know boss…

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: Time to end this!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: You asked for it.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Start praying.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: So should we kiss now? Nah, maybe later.
[Next scene. Fisk in handcuffs lead to the police van, on the roof of which sits our hero. Journalists and onlookers bustle around.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Finally off to Ryker’s, huh? You know. I think you’ve got more enemies in there than I do.

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: If you think this will be more than a minor inconvenience.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I’ve a feeling you’re gonna need it.

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: Idiot! I’m the one who kept order in this city! One month! In one month you’ll wish you had me back!
[Next scene. Spidey sits on a roof.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: The Kingpin is heading to prison. End of an era. Feel like I should celebrate. Maybe take a vacation…

Speaker: Boss
Text: Parker, where are you? The committee will be here soon! We need to run an equipment check!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I’m almost there! Blocks away!

Speaker: Boss
Text: Ugh. Guess I’ll just do it myself.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: No, don’t, it’s not safe!
[Call ends]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Gotta love Doc’s enthusiasm, but sometimes it gets him into trouble. Better get there before he hurts himself…
[Spidey swings to his work – the laboratory…]

Speaker: Peter
Text: Sorry I’m late… whoa!  You started without me!

Speaker: Otto
Text: The grant committee’s director will be here soon. It’s fine, Parker. I invented this equipment. I think I can handle it.
[Something explodes.]

Speaker: Peter
Text: The power dampener. Oh man…! Uh… maybe we should abort?!

Speaker: Otto
Text: Not yet.
[Several consoles blow up, fire is starting. Peter pushes emergency shutdown and starts extinguishing the fire.]

Speaker: Peter
Text: Hold on, Dr. Octavius! Are you okay?

Speaker: Otto
Text: Another setback. But we’re close.
[Committee arrives.]

Speaker: Committee Director
Text: Is anyone hurt?

Speaker: Otto
Text: The energy levels exceeded our expectations. From a certain viewpoint, that’s a very positive development. I assure you, in the next phase --

Speaker: Committee Director
Text: Is there somewhere else we can discuss this?

Speaker: Otto
Text: Maybe you should take the rest of the day off, Peter. We’ll talk later.
[Otto and the Committee go into his office.]

Speaker: Peter
Text: That was a disaster. How could the dampener have failed? I know Doc said take the day off, but I have to figure out what went wrong…
[He sees broken prosthetic hand.]

Speaker: Peter
Text: Ohh… you are in bad shape, little guy. Let’s see what’s wrong with you… Let’s see if that worked. Good as new.
[He finds some documents.]

Speaker: Peter
Text: Doc’s been testing new materials for the prosthetic. He asked me to review his work if I had time; may as well dig in now.

Speaker: Peter
Text: Alright - I should get out of here before I screw things up for Doc even more.
[He leaves the laboratory and put on the mask.]

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Spider-Man, it’s Yuri.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Fisk make it to Ryker’s yet?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Not Ryker’s. Our boy qualifies for the VIP treatment… he’s in The Raft.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Ahhh - joining Scorpion, Electro and the rest… Fisk should be honoured - that’s esteemed company.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Can you swing by the precinct? Got an issue that could benefit from your unique skill set.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: For you, Yuri: anything. I’m on my way.
[On the way…]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hmmm - looks like Jameson’s got a new episode out. Wonder what my number one fan thinks about the Fisk take down…

Speaker: “Just the Facts With JJJ” Producer
Text: This is “Just The Facts with J. Jonah Jameson”, where listeners like you discuss the issues affecting our city with Pulitzer Prize winning two-time! Two-time Pulitzer Prize winning former publisher of the Daily Bugle. Hey, plug the book! And as always, if you order Mr. Jameson’s book: “Spider-Man: Threat or Menace.” Within 24 hours of our broadcast you’ll get an autographed copy at no extra charge. No personalisations! Don’t ask, not gonna get it!!

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Welcome to “Just the Facts” With J. Jonah Jameson alerting you to the threats you don’t even know about, Let’s dive right into the calls. Speak!

Speaker: Caller
Text: Okay, so, not for nothin’, you gotta give Spider-Man respect for taking down Wilson Fisk, right? I mean, one less mob boss is good for everybody.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Is that fight? Tell me, are you a police officer? Prosecutor? Maybe an award-winning reporter with decades on the job, like me?

Speaker: Caller
Text: Uh, no. I’m a plumber.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: Oho good. Then fix my toilet and SHUT UP! Let me explain something to you about crime bosses. Speaker: Caller
Text: Yeah, well. I can get copper pipe without paying kickbacks now. So until that gang war starts, I’m on the web-head’s side.

Speaker: Jameson
Text: And you’ll be singing a different tune when three new mobs are lining up to charge you triple for that same pipe… or just break your legs! GOODBYE!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Some day, Jonah.
[He meet with Yuri on a police station roof.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Now that you quit smoking, what do you tell people when you come up here?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: That I need a break from their crap.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Fair enough. So why’d you call? Need a date to the policeman’s ball?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: You got a black and white suit?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Uhh…

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: No ball this year anyway. We spent too much integrating Oscorp’s surveillance tech. It was… until an hour ago. The whole system went down. City wide. Every tower.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: How?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: They tell me someone sabotaged the central server, and now all the towers are offline.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hm, inside job?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Maybe. I’ll figure that out later. Right now we need to get these towers back online. Fast.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: And you called me? Aw, that’s sweet.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: I called someone I can trust. Plus the signals are scrambled and we have no idea how to fix it.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Ooh! I love a challenge.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: You break it you buy it.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I thought you trusted me!
[Yuri leaves.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Let’s take a look at thus tower. Input bands have been shifted. Subtle.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: We just had a tower come back online, was that you?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Not just a pretty mask, eh?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Whatever you did, any chance you could do it to the other towers?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Sure. But just so you know. I had to sync up with the tower to fix it. I’m seeing all crime data in the area now. Looks like there’s a break-in happening near me.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Great. I’ve got units nearby --

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Don’t bother - I’m on it.
[He arrives at the place and sees a couple of thugs…]

Speaker: Thug
Text: Watch my back.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Pretty sure these guys didn’t forget their keys.

Speaker: Thug
Text: He’s in the air-- what do we do?!

Speaker: Thug
Text: Leave us alone!

Speaker: Thug
Text: OK, beginning to thunk we’re outmatched here.

Speaker: Thug
Text: That’s gonna leave a mark!

Speaker: Thug
Text: Quit playin’ around!

Speaker: Thug
Text: Get ready for some pain!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Okay: wrapped up.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Thanks for that. Now I’m seeing an assault near you.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: You’re in luck. Yuri. Your favourite tough but lovable, grizzled, seen-too-much detective is in town.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: What? No, no, no, no, no, you promised you wouldn’t do that any --

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Spider-Cop.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Please no.
[He arrives at the place and sees a couple of thugs harassing innocent girl…]

Speaker: Thug
Text: So, you’re the snitch.

Speaker: Gloria
Text: Back off, creep.

Speaker: Thug
Text: Yep, she’s the one.

Speaker: Gloria
Text: I said back off!

Speaker: Gloria
Text: Leave me alone!

Speaker: Thug
Text: Keep it quiet, lady.

Speaker: Gloria
Text: Don’t touch me!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Get away from her!

Speaker: Thug
Text: Aw crap. Spider-Man.

Speaker: Thug
Text: OK, beginning to think we’re outmatched here.

Speaker: Thug
Text: Get out of the way!

Speaker: Thug
Text: Walk away now or she’s dead!

Speaker: Gloria
Text: Let me go!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: All clear. Ma’am.

Speaker: Gloria
Text: I knew Jameson was wrong about you. You’re a little weird, but you got a good heart.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Have you got somewhere to go?

Speaker: Gloria
Text: I can take care of myself.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I’m sure you can. But just in case, there’s a place called the F.E.A.S.T. Center. They got the best wheatcakes in the city, hands down.

Speaker: Gloria
Text: Mom used to make those. Haven’t had any… in a long time. I’ll check it out. Thanks, Spider-Guy.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: It’s Spider-Man… oh well. Should be able to spot the next tower from up there. From his elevated position, Spider-Cop spies his destination: a second surveillance tower.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Are you… narrating yourself?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: What? No. Of course not… The chief never did understand Spider-Cop. Thought he was a loose cannon.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Already regretting this…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Bet I can modify these towers to track more than just crimes… Score!
[Spidey fix the tower.]

Speaker: Spider-Man

Text: How’s it going with you?

Speaker: MJ
Text: Hm. I feel like there’s a bigger story there… Let’s not make this all about business. How’s it going with you? Did you got that promotion?

Speaker: Peter
Text: No, but we’re on the cusp of something really big.

Speaker: MJ
Text: You know Oscorp would hire you in a heartbeat, right? One phone call to Harry…

Speaker: Peter
Text: Sure. But Dr. Octavius’ work will help millions. I’m right where I want to be-- right where I *should* be.

Speaker: MJ
Text: Almost sounds like it’s more important than your other job. I’ve never heard you talk like that before.

Speaker: Peter
Text: A lot can change in six months.

Speaker: MJ
Text: Why did you ask me here, Pete?

Speaker: Peter
Text: You know. Just… dinner between friends.

Speaker: MJ
Text: Friends. Is that what we are?

Speaker: Peter
Text: H mean we could be. If that’s what you wanted.

Speaker: MJ
Text: There’s a lot of baggage here.

Speaker: Peter
Text: Yeah sure but, Is that so bad? I mean baggage can carry good things too. Like uh--like money and uh, keys, and raspberry lip balm.

Speaker: MJ
Text: Do you remember why we broke up?

Speaker: Peter
Text: This is a trick question, isn’t it?
[They hear police siren noise.]

Speaker: MJ
Text: Saved by the siren.

Speaker: Peter
Text: Talk to you later?

Speaker: MJ
Text: Go.

Speaker: Short Order Cook (Stan Lee)
Text: Love seeing you two together again! You always were my favourites.
[MJ leaves the dinner.]
[Spidey calls Yuri.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hey it’s me. What’s with the units heading down third?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Looks like our old friend Herman Schultz is at it again.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Shocker. Didn’t he just get paroled?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Yeah, well, guess it didn’t take.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: No worries-- Herman’s just a big cupcake. I’ll have him back in Ryker’s by bedtime.  Just had dinner with my ex after saving her from masked criminals… and now I’m gonna go beat up a maniac who uses shock waves to rob people. What a perfectly normal life you have, Peter Parker.

Speaker: Police Dispatch
Text: Officers respond, we’ve got a 10-10 narcotics in progress. Incident is active near Times Square, proceed with caution.
[Spidey got a call from Dr. Octavius.]

Speaker: Otto
Text: Peter, I just want to make sure you haven’t left any equipment you’ve built for your… friend… around the lab. It’s no bother to me, but if the grant committee stops by again --

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Don’t worry. Doc. I make a point not to leave anything there. But I know my “friend” appreciates you looking out for him. There’s a lot of people who don’t like him very much.

Speaker: Otto
Text: That buffoon Jameson and his audience of sheep? Please.

Speaker: Otto
Text: The people who do great things in this world are those who don’t let bullies like him stand in their way. People like us!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: You said a mouthful, Doc. Take care.

Speaker: Police Dispatch
Text: Available units, need response to a break in. Officers near Bowery, please respond.
[Spidey arrives at the scene of the robbery.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hi, Herman.

Speaker: Shocker
Text: Seriously? Grr…  Give it up. You’re never gonna catch me.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: That’s what you said last time.

Speaker: Shocker
Text: I don’t wanna hurt you, it’ll just slow me down.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Wow, that’s… considerate. What’s the money for, Herman?

Speaker: Shocker
Text: Why do you care?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Actually, I don’t. Just trying to make polite conversation…

Speaker: Shocker
Text: I’m done talking.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: But this could be so much more rewarding if we connected on an emotional level…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Wait, I forgot, you don’t have any emotions.  Gotcha. Now let’s talk.

Speaker: Shocker
Text: I said I’m…*DONE*…*TALKING*!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Noted.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Honestly Herman, why are you robbing again? You know the police are watching your every move. I mean, we all know you’re kinda dumb, but I didn’t think you were *this* dumb. You must be desperate. Which means you’re not just stealing for yourself. You must be working with someone. Or *for* someone… You can tell me who it is now, or make me punch it out of you later. Your choice!

Speaker: Shocker
Text: I’ve said enough.
[Spidey defeats Shocker.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: You know what Herman, you have like zero personality… but your suit is awesome. Can we talk design details? Maybe later.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Good work, Spider-Man. Did you learn anything about his motive?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I tried. But he’s not very talkative. Plus, I think he hates me.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: You have that effect on a lot of people.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: But you love me, right Yuri?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: I tolerate you.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Wow. That might be the nicest thing you’ve ever said to me.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Looks like I got some free time. Maybe now’s a good time to look into that mask.
[His phone ringing.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Oh. It’s MJ. Hey MJ. You’re up late.

Speaker: MJ
Text: Just catching up on the news-- looks like you had quite an adventure with Shocker tonight.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yeah, he was unusually combative. Anyway, thanks again for dinner, what do I owe you?

Speaker: MJ
Text: How about a favour? You still have that mask from the gallery?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yeah. I’m actually on my way to the F.E.A.S.T. Center now to ask Martin Li about it.

Speaker: MJ
Text: Martin Li? Why?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: He has a degree in Art History. If anyone knows about the origins of that mask, he will.

Speaker: MJ
Text: Just keep me in the loop. Like I said. I think there’s a bigger story here. And I plan to be the one to break it.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Uh, sure. So I can call you, like whenever?

Speaker: MJ
Text: Yeah. Whenever, whatever.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: So I guess we’re talking again. Cool. Almost morning. Mr. Li will be here soon. I could use a snack…
[Later at F.E.A.S.T. Center.]

Speaker: Martin Li
Text: Peter! What can I do for you?

Speaker: Peter
Text: Sorry to bother you, Mr. Li… She’s doing a story about art imports, and she found this piece… and she wanted an expert opinion on it, and I know you have a degree --

Speaker: Martin Li
Text: Let’s see what you have. Interesting. Where did she find it…? A replica of an antique Chinese opera mask. I haven’t seen one in years. This symbol here roughly translates to “Demon.”

Speaker: Peter
Text: “Demon”?

Speaker: Martin Li
Text: My father read me ghost stories with that mask and symbol in it when I was young. Scared the hell out of me. Peter, listen. That mask, it’s… It could be connected to dangerous people. Mary Jane might want to find a different story.

Speaker: Peter
Text: You think she’s in trouble?

Speaker: Martin Li
Text: I don’t know. Why take the risk?
[Peter leave and call MJ.]

Speaker: MJ
Text: Hey.

Speaker: Peter
Text: The symbol inside the mask means “Demon.” It really spooked Mr. Li. Never seen him like that. He even said you should drop the story.

Speaker: MJ
Text: Fat chance. Do you think Mr. Li knows more than he’s letting on?

Speaker: Peter
Text: No. I think he just had a weird flashback or something. I know his childhood was pretty traumatic…

Speaker: MJ
Text: Yeah, makes sense. Demons, huh? Catchy name. Okay, gotta get writing. See you soon.

Speaker: Peter
Text: Well, that went about as well as I could’ve hoped…
[Next scene Spidey swings around the city and get a call from Aunt May.]

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: Peter. Mr. Li spoke to me… he seemed worried. Are you into something dangerous?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Oh, it’s just a story Mary Jane’s investigating. Don’t worry. I’ll make sure she’s careful.

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: Please tell me you two are back together.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: We’re talking again. Baby steps. I hope I didn’t upset Mr. Li.

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: He’s just concerned. I was actually touched by how concerned. I knew he liked you - he admires how dedicated you are to helping others. I think you remind him of himself when he was younger. Both orphans, both so smart…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Well the admiration’s mutual. You’ve got a good boss, May.

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: I’ll tell him you said so. Love you, Peter.
[Spidey got a call fron Otto Octavius.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hello?

Speaker: Otto
Text: Peter, it’s Doctor Octavius.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Oh, hey, what’s up?

Speaker: Otto
Text: Lance Corporal Texidor is here for a fitting.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I totally forgot! I mean. I didn’t forget-forget, I just… Uh. I’ll be there soon.

Speaker: Otto
Text: This tardiness is starting to become a pattern. Come on, Parker. You’re better than this.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Ugh, he’s right. How did I lose track of time? Grr…
[Spidey go back to the lab.]

Speaker: Veteran
Text: How does it work?

Speaker: Otto
Text: Just like a natural arm. You think of what you want it to do, and…!

Speaker: Peter
Text: Yes!! Hey!  Hey! Wh-what do you think you’re doing?

Speaker: City Worker
Text: This site’s been declared a safety hazard.
[The people trying to power off lab’s devices.]

Speaker: Otto
Text: Stop that right now! This is highly sensitive equipment. That’s it, I’m calling the mayor’s office directly!

Speaker: Norman Osborn
Text: Peter Parker! How the hell are you.

Speaker: Otto
Text: Speak of the Devil.

Speaker: Peter
Text: Mr. Osborn, what –

Speaker: Norman
Text: Oh please. How long have we known each other? It’s “Mr. Mayor.” It’s Norman. Norman!

Speaker: Otto
Text: Norman, what do you think you’re doing?

Speaker: Norman
Text: The grant agreement you signed has strict safety provisions. This isn’t your first violation.

Speaker: Otto
Text: Those were excused --

Speaker: Norman
Text: By me. We should have confiscated this equipment long ago.

Speaker: Otto
Text: But, but I’ve had a breakthrough --

Speaker: Norman
Text: Thank you for your great service to our country. These folks will escort you to Oscorp Robotics, where you’ll receive the latest in prosthetics, no charge.

Speaker: Otto
Text: This isn’t about safety infractions, is it?

Speaker: Norman
Text: I’m trying to help you. Otto. You’re free to continue your work… in a secure environment.

Speaker: Otto
Text: At Oscorp.

Speaker: Norman
Text: You always were the smartest guy in the room.

Speaker: Otto
Text: You haven’t changed a bit.

Speaker: Norman
Text: Neither have you. Hey Peter. Harry will be coming back from Europe early next year. Maybe the two of you can start that business you always talked about. This is opportunity knocking.

Speaker: Peter
Text: Easy. They didn’t take everything. Maybe we can start over --

Speaker: Otto
Text: Peter… there’s no “we.” Without the grant from the city, I can no longer pay you. I need some time to think. If I were you… I’d look for a new job.
[Next scene. Spidey swings around the city. He gets a call from Yuri.]

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Spider-Man. Shocker has escaped. And now he’s robbing a bank on East Thirty-First.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: What happened? I thought he was behind bars?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: He was.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: But one of the guards just walked up to his cell and released him, then gave him his suit back.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I *knew* Shocker was working for someone. What’d you get out of the guard?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Wish I could ask him, but he’s dead. Whoever made him release Shocker didn’t want any loose ends.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Damn.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Looking at the security footage, the guard was in some kind of trance. And it might have been the lighting, but it looked like his eyes were glowing.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Well that’s creepy. Okay. I’ll see what I can get out of Shocker when I get to the bank.
[Spidey face Shocker at the bank.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Herman! Long time no see. Hey I’m no lawyer, but uhh… I’m pretty sure that’s a parole violation. Oops, guess we’re stuck in here for a while. Wanna play twenty questions? No? How about we thumb-wrestle? Okay. Face-punch it is… Whoa! Your gauntlets are all digital now, aren’t they?

Speaker: Shocker
Text: RHAAAAAHHHH! DIE!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Remember our first fight? Me, so young and stupid. You, just stupid.

Speaker: Shocker
Text: You talk too much.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Well, that’s a matter of opinion. I mean, are there any standard metrics for how much talking one should do? And who determines the ideal ratio of talking versus not-talking? Also, how would you measure it? Words per minute? Syllables per second? Or is it more about how many words one uses to express a single thought? It’s all so subjective… If you ask me, some people don’t talk enough. Like about who their mysterious overlord is the person they’re working for, that kind of thing. Okay, now I can do some real damage. Why are you doing this, Herman?

Speaker: Shocker
Text: Because if I don’t, they’ll kill me!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Comin’ your way! If you come clean, I can help you.

Speaker: Shocker
Text: You really want to help me? Just let me have the money.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Sorry, not gonna happen. You know, people don’t use banks anymore. You’re lucky you found actual cash. If you really want to rob banks… Try day trading. It’s all the rage. Oh-- wait, wait, wait, wait… oh no! Aw, come on. Herman… If you tell me who you’re working for. I can help you cut a deal.

Speaker: Shocker
Text: If I talk-- I’m dead. They made that very clear.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Catch! You’re freaking me out, Herman. It’s not like you to be afraid of people.

Speaker: Shocker
Text: Not even sure these guys *are* people. Could be anything under those masks…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Wait. Did you say *masks*? These mask guys, what do they want the money for?

Speaker: Shocker
Text: Don’t know, don’t care. Soon as I finish the job. I’m gone.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: This one’s gonna hurt!

Speaker: Shocker
Text: Stand still!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: If you ask nicely. MAYBE. Okay, catch this one with your face! Give up now and we can protect you.

Speaker: Shocker
Text: No way. You ain’t seen what I seen. What the --. You son of a --

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Okay, last chance to give up. This time I *really* mean it.

Speaker: Shocker
Text: Quit moving!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Okay. I was kidding before.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: NOW is your last-last chance. Seriously. Sorry, Herman.  with You brought this on yourself… literally.
[Spidey leaves the bank.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Man, he was scared, and desperate. These demons are everywhere all of a sudden… Okay Yuri. Shocker’s all yours now.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Good work. We have a special cell waiting for him at the RAFT. We’ll make sure he stays behind bars this time.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Also. I’m pretty sure he was working for the demon gang.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Demon gang? Sounds like a Daily Bugle headline.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: The Bugle is a perfectly fine news organization…

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Not sure I’d call it “news.”

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Well. I’ve heard they have some really good reporters. Anyway, have you had any more reports on demon… er… guys with masks?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Let me get back to you. By the way, how much of a mess did you make inside that bank?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: You probably don’t want to know.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Ugh. Shouldn’t have asked…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Fight with Shocker took a while. Time to catch up on what I’ve been missing out in the city. Doc left a message…
[He checks his voicemail.]

Speaker: Otto
Text: Peter. I might have been a bit hasty advising you to find another job. I have a plan. Give me a bit of time… we may yet live to invent another day!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: The indomitable Otto Octavius. That’s great news - hope his plan works.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Hey, so I looked into reports of… “Demons.”

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I knew you’d come around.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: They’ve been pretty busy tonight-- hitting a lot of Fisk properties.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: They’re going after Fisk? Damn. You thinking what I’m thinking?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Brewing gang war?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Let’s try to get ahead of it. Are there any Fisk properties that *haven’t* been hit tonight?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Let me see. Patrol reported a bunch of activity at one of his shipyards in Portside.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Thanks Yuri, I’ll check it out. Hey Yuri, any idea what Fisk uses that shipyard for?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: No idea. Let me send an officer to meet you there. His name’s Jefferson Davis-- that’s his beat. He’s a good cop, been working the Fisk case for years. If anyone knows what‘s going on at that shipyard, it’s him.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: My suit’s onboard A.I, can tell me the most likely area where the victim is.
[Spidey swings to the shipyard.]

Speaker: Wilson Fisk
Text: -and if they set *one toe* inside the vault, I’ll have your head.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Got it, boss. Tripling security. Demons won’t touch a thing.  Listen up! Demons’re making moves on all our caches. Lost two tonight already. Boss may be in lockup, but that don’t mean his hardware’s up for grabs.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Comm check, Eagle 2. You up?

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Eagle 2 reporting in. Eyes on.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: What “caches” are the Demons after? Need to take out Fisk’s men and figure out what they’re guarding, whatever it is. I don’t want it in Fisk’s OR the Demon’s hands… Snipers everywhere… might need to deal with them first… Lot of junk scattered around here a well placed web shot could make a great distraction… That sniper has a guard watching him… They keep talking about gear what does Fisk store here?

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: How long’s the boss had this place for? Looks ancient.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Only a decade or two.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Been through a dozen different owners before.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Dope smugglers in the 80s, booze runners back in the 20s.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Kid you really are slow, you know that? It’s an old bootlegger hideout.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Ohhhh whoa. So tunnels and secret rooms and stuff?

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: “Tunnels and stuff,” yeah. Like the tunnel right beneath us I’m trying to seal up while you’re standing there gabbing.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hmmm any tunnel Fisk is trying to *seal* is a tunnel I want to check out…

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Cobra One, come in.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Naming on the packaging for this stuff’s confusing.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: We got 2-23. CR-17, and 0-12.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: CR-twenty… crap. I don’t have numbers. Just names. “Shaped charges,” “detonator caps,” “blasting gel.”

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: What the hell?

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Spider-Man’s here!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Dunno, that you?

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Even the rats are stayin’ away.

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Spider-Man’s here - stay alert!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: What the hell?

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Spider-Man’s here!

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: What…?

Speaker: Fisk Thug
Text: Heads up! I see him!
[When Spidey defeats all the thugs, a police car arrives at the scene.]

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: You know we can’t have vigilantes trespassing or doing illegal searches…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yeah. I know…

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Which is why I brought a warrant. So what do you say we do some perfectly legal searching?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I like the sound of that. What’s your name?

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Officer Davis. Call me Jeff. And you are?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Uh…

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Just messing with you. My son’s a big fan.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: So. That warrant cover breaking down doors?

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Not without a LOT of extra paperwork.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Okay. I’ll find another way in. Any place this run down should have a hole in the wall or a broken window…

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Check around back. I’d go myself but, you know, not Spider-Man.
[Spidey finds his way into the warehouse.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I feel like I’m in a horror movie. Hello? Any fishermen with a grudge and a hook for a hand? Okay, where’s that locked door? Jeff, you there? I’m doing my best to refrain from knock-knock jokes.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Appreciated. You see a junction box powering the door?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yeah, got it.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: If we can overload it, that should force the door open.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Smart but I don’t have anything that packs enough current…

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Try this.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Stun gun. Genius! Capacitors in this are just what I need for an upgrade I’ve been thinking of. Electric Web for the win!

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Gadget man, huh? You remind me of my son. Started taking apart the TV when he was five. Now he’s unlocking his friends’ phones.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Sounds like he could teach me a few things.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Okay, nothing illegal in plain sight.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Kind of anticlimactic, huh?

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: At first glance. Let’s look closer.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Looking for something specific?

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: This yard’s been here a long time. Bootleggers used to use it back in the day.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Gotcha. Those guys loved their hidden rooms.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Check it out. Sound hollow to you? I got a hidden panel, like the one on the doom The conduits lead out the back. Look for another junction box.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Let’s see if my mask lenses can pick up the conduits. Did that work?

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Nah. Must not be the right box. Keep looking. Thanks, no way I could’ve unlocked this myself.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hey. I doubt I would’ve found it without you. Hm. We got a big fat nothing.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Where there’s one secret room, there could be more. Notice anything about the floor?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Aha. They can hide the doors, but not the scrapes they leave.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Keep an eye out for more of those.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Now that I know I’m after scrapes. I should take another look around. Where else could there be scrapes? Paydirt! Scrape, no door. None I can see, anyway.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Great. Be right there. Maybe not. Elevator’s busted.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Sit tight. I’ll pull you up. Second floor, rusted machine parts, big honkin’ rats. Careful, the bridge is out.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: I got this one.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Nice, stuck the landing and everything.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: We’re not *all* doughnut eaters.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Fair enough.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Another secret door. I’ll rig the lock. Let me know if you find the junction box.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yep. On it. Found one. Nailed it!

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Hell yeah you did! Hey, check this out.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Nothing. I’m starting to feel like this is Fisk’s way of messing with me.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: But look at the walls. They kept guns here. They wouldn’t’ve moved ‘em through the front door. Gotta be a passageway we’re missing. Check out the wall - this might control access to another area.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Fisk’s men were talking about a “vault” maybe we’re close?

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Bet on it. Looks like a dual circuit, see if you can find a second junction box.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Found it! Clear! You were right Jeff - trap door.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Outstanding! Think you can help me out? This thing’s heavy. One, two, three.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: That isn’t spooky at all.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Big chunk of concrete in the way… I can’t get through.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Let me see how it looks from the top.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Sounded like explosives.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: And that sounds like Demons.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: The vault! Hurry! Come on - let’s go!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Damn. Demons’re already gone. How’d they beat us here?

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Must be a back door, see if you can find it.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Smash and grab. They were moving fast. Got empty crates here… and it looks like they took the ones they didn’t clean out. There they blew the locks to get in. Shh! Demons. That’s what I’m talking about!

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Just trying to do my part. Firing - stay clear!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hey. Jeff, one of your tricks would be great about how!

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Got him!

Speaker: Demon
Text: (I will not hesitate.]

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Reloading!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Now you’re just showing off.

Speaker: Jefferson Davis
Text: Says the guy dodging bullets.

Speaker: Demon

[Spidey enters the prison.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Everyone just quietly go back into your cell and lock the door behind you! Okay? Please?!

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: I’m gonna gut you, spider!

Speaker: Intercom
Text: Power failure in cell block C.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Gonna feel this!

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Nobody’s putting me back in a cell…

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: You got a death wish? I can help with that.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Ain’t fair!

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: We’re droppin’ like flies - pick it up!

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: It’s over, punk!

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: I like it way better on this side of the bars.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: What is that?

Speaker: Intercom
Text: Catastrophic event detected.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: That doesn’t sound good. Hi Rhino.

Text: Hope you like surprise, spider.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Surprise? What is he talking about?

Speaker: Intercom
Text: Unexpected power surge detected. Incident response team required. Electrical fire detected.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Hey, what’s your status?
[Behind his back the tail of the Scorpion lowers.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Me? Just trapped in a prison with every criminal I’ve put away in the last eight years. No biggie.
[Scorpion grabs Spidey.]

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: This is too good to be true…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Scorpion-- can you hold on a minute? I was in the middle of a phone call and it was business--
[Something explodes and Scorpion leaves. Spidey is left alone with a bunch of prisoners.]

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Nobody’s putting me back in a cell.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Lost you for a second there-- you okay?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Not really. Electro, Rhino, and now Scorpion are all on the loose. What’s going on in the rest of the prison?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Camera system’s almost up. I’ll give you a sit rep soon.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Okay. I’ll keep tracking Electro…

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Hold still!

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: What the hell?

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Lemme show you what I got!

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: He felt that one!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Phew. Whoa!

Speaker: Electro
Text: C’mon Spider-Man. I thought this was a chase!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Gotta stop this guy…

Speaker: Electro
Text: You can’t stop me-- but I‘m flattered that you’re still trying.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: If you tell me who you’re working for. I’ll go easy on you! Nobody ever takes me up on that offer… Gotcha.
[He defeats Electro but suddenly someone grabs him from behind.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Vulture?!

Speaker: Vulture
Text: Long time no see. We’re going to have so much f--

Speaker: Electro
Text: Still with me, huh?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Okay. I got the security cameras back online.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: How does it look?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Well… it looks like the entire population of The Raft has escaped. Including Martin Li. That makes FIVE of your worst enemies that are now on the loose.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Ha. For a second there I thought you were serious.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: I *am* serious. I have to go-- some of them are heading into the city.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: This is nuts.

Speaker: Intercom
Text: System reboot failed.

Speaker: Electro
Text: Keep chasing party’s almost over.

Speaker: Intercom
Text: System error… system error… system error…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Electro! Stop!

Speaker: Electro
Text: How do you like my new suit?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Dashing. Where’d you get it?

Speaker: Electro
Text: It’s an exclusive club.
[Rhino, Scorpion, Vulture and Mister Negative appears.]

Speaker: Mister Negative
Text: Remember, he said not to kill him.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Good idea. In fact, we don’t have to do this at all if you don’t want to--

Speaker: Rhino
Text: We definitely want to.
[They beat Spider-Man half to death.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Doctor Octavius?

Speaker: Otto
Text: First and final warning. Stay out of our way.
[He grabs his foot with his tentacles and throws him from the skyscraper.]

Speaker: Otto
Text: Each of you has a job to do. Your debts will be repaid when we’re done.
[Some time passes. Captain Watanabe finds Spidey floating unconscious on the river.]

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: There he is!
[Meanwhile, Dr. Octopus armed with Devil’s Breath overlooks the city’s downtown street. He stands in front of the big screen, transmitting the appeal of the mayor Osborne.]

Speaker: Otto
Text: All these years, all these lies. It’s over Norman. Time to give them the truth.
[He releases the Devil’ Breath.]
[F.E.A.S.T. Aunt May, with all her strength, helps people who was infected with the Devil’s Breath. It seems that she herself is not very good.]

Speaker: MJ
Text: This is Mary Jane Watson with a Daily Bugle special report on the bio-terror attack-- As of this hour, the number of infected Civilians is approaching half a million.

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: Yeah… fine. Can you… can you pass those… out for me?

Speaker: Volunteer
Text: Sure.

Speaker: MJ
Text: There is still no update from the NDC on the timetable for an antiserum, but they are working around the clock on a cure for this deadly disease… The city-wide quarantine is being heavily enforced. by Sable international… who maintain tight security over all transit points. Throughout the city. Police and Sable Agents continue to battle with Ryker’s and Raft escapees… Meanwhile, Mayor Osborn has gone on record blaming Spider-Man for the prison break and the city-wide sickness, and branding him a fugitive. But he has yet to provide evidence… and many believe the mayor is just deflecting blame, since an exclusive report by the Bugle revealed that this disease originated in a secret, unregulated Oscorp laboratory here in Manhattan. Mayor Osborn insists that Oscorp is working with the NDC on an antiserum, but has not provided any further evidence to support this claim--

Speaker: Norman Osborne
Text: Turn it off!
[The secretary runs up and turns off the TV. Norman breaks a glass of whiskey, which he holds in his hands. Blood dripping on the floor.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Dr. Octavius… why…? How did I let this happen?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Just got a call from the hospital… they said you went AWOL…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Need to get back to work…

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: The doctors said you still have fourteen broken bones.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Which means I have one hundred and ninety two *non* broken ones. Thanks for taking care of me, by the way.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: The hard part was keeping you hidden from Sable. They‘ve branded you a ‘priority target’ you know.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I humbly accept the honour. What is happening to our city, Yuri?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: I don’t know. Feels like the end of the world. Maybe it is.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I’m here to help.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Good. There’s gangs of escaped prisoners banding together and taking over entire city blocks. Looting, strong-arming local residents, you name it.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I’ll take care of ‘em. What else you got?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: The mayor told Silver Sable to do whatever it takes to find Li and Octavius. So she’s just rounding people up indiscriminately, holding them captive in bases around the city. I’ve even heard rumours of enhanced interrogation tactics.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: You mean torture. Don’t worry. I’m on it. This is our city Yuri-- it’s time we take it back.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Great. My men are tracking the super villains; I’ll update you when we make progress. For now do your best to stabilise the city.

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: Peter! I’ve been trying to reach you all day – are you OK? The prison break turned the city upside down overnight.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I’m fine May - staying safe. I’m more worried about you.

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: Oh no - don’t you do that. F.E.A.S.T. IS the safest place in the city right now. Our sister locations uptown - not so much. But we’re safe and secure down here.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Let’s hope it stays that way. I’ll stop by when I can, May. Love you.

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: You too, Peter.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Spider-Man. The Raft MVPs are back on the grid, laying siege to our police precincts. My men need your help - now. Get to a vantage point in midtown and I’ll explain.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: On my way. Is it Octavius?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: No. Two of his flunkies. Still searching for the Doctor. I have to be honest… that one scares me. Might be the smartest Super Villain I’ve ever encountered.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yeah… that’s what I’m worried about. Hold tight, Captain.
[He swings to the place.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: OK captain. Got eyes on - fill me in.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Rhino’s assaulting the Upper West Precinct; Electro’s at the Upper East. We need you to turn the tide. Head to either - they’re both equally screwed.

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: Peter, are you available? We need help at F.E.A.S.T.’s Sister site uptown.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: The Veteran’s Center in Harlem? What’s wrong?

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: Men from Ryker’s are demanding food and supplies. The staff are barricaded inside, but they need help. Miles and I are headed there to evacuate the staff.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Don’t do anything until I get there, May. I’ll meet you in Harlem. May sounds exhausted, really hope she isn’t sick. Need to help Yuri, then get to Harlem. Yuri: I’m nearing the Upper East precinct.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Good - Electro and the Demons are boxing my men in… The set up is… complicated. You’ll understand when you get there.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yuri Watanabe: master of suspense.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: This isn’t good. Transformers are charging the building, trapping the police inside. Yuri. “Complicated” was an understatement. I’m gonna have to disable these transformers to free your men.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Even if you manage that, they’ll still need your help with the Demons.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: That’s why I’m here - ready to serve all your electricity-and-Demon related needs. Five transformers total. Loading them up with webbing should cause them to overheat… Four more of these suckers… How did they even get that thing attached? And it can’t be easy to fly like that - did they train specifically for this one obscure scenario? So many questions. Two down, three to go, o Man. I did not miss dealing with Electro’s elaborate Super Villain antics while he was in The Raft. Trapping the police with a network of energy transformers… who does that?

Speaker: Demon
Text: (We must keep the transformers safe!]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Only 1 more… Police are free, but Demons aren’t backing down; need to lend a hand.

Speaker: Demon
Text: (This city will fear us.]

Speaker: Demon
Text: (How’s he doing that?]

Speaker: Demon
Text: (Slow him down!]

Speaker: Demon
Text: (Don’t back down!]

Speaker: Demon
Text: (Grenade!]

Speaker: Demon
Text: (Break him!]

Speaker: Demon
Text: (What’d he hit us with?!]

Speaker: Demon
Text: (He’s hurt!]

Speaker: Demon
Text: (Clear the area!]

Speaker: Demon
Text: (Do not get in our way.]

Speaker: Demon
Text: (Defeat is unacceptable!]

Speaker: Demon
Text: (He’s wounded!]

Speaker: Demon
Text: (Close in!]

Speaker: Demon
Text: (We need support!]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yuri: your men are safe. What’s next?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Get to the Upper West Side. We’re trying to shelter civilians, but Rhino isn’t making it easy.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: He never does. On my way.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: I see you down there. Officer Daws! You can’t hide!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Miles left a voicemail…

Speaker: Miles
Text: Pete! Hey. Pete. Hey, May wanted me to call you. Things at the Veteran’s Center are not good. Convicts are trying to break down the doors. Mary Jane’s here but we’re getting people out through the basement; we need more help. I hope you can get here soon.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I need finish with the precincts fast and get to Harlem. We’re gonna need a bigger transport van.
[Rhino fights with the police and throws cars.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Rhino’s on the move, but former guests of Rykers are laying into your police barricades. I’m going to even the odds.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Do it. If those barricades fall, the people inside are done for.

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: Keep pushing - don’t let them through the barricade! Thanks, Spider-Man - help our men at the other barricades!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Never seen Rhino walk away from a fight like this… he must be working on orders from Dr. Octavius. Making quick hit-and-runs on the city’s emergency response teams.

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: Hold the line! People inside are counting on you.

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: Thanks Spidey! Get to the other barricade they need you!

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: Hey! Everyone cover Spider-Man! He can’t do this alone!

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Keep it up - they’re gonna break!

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: Keep at it Spider-Man - you’re turning the tide!

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: Spider-Man! Up top! Convict’s launching RPGs - they’ll bring down the building!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Not gonna let that happen; I’m on it. One roof clear.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Nice to see you, Spider! How about some payback for puttin’ me away?

Speaker: Sable Agent
Text: Priority target acquired. Proceeding to pacify.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: There are easier ways to ask for an autograph. Jetpacks? Who thought it was a good idea to give these guys jetpacks? Guys: we’re on the same team! At least wait to attack me til after we take out the convicts!

Speaker: Sable Agent
Text: All lawbreakers will be pacified.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: “Pacify.” Anyone else feeling very “1984” right now? Oh, just me? Come on, anybody? Did you guys design those little energy bola things just for me? I’m both flattered and horrified. That’s it for Sable’s airborne commandos; now to mop up the rest of the Ryker’s escapees. Yuri. Precinct is secure. And I just found out what it means to be Sable’s “priority target.” Not fun.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: That’ll teach you to piss off international mercenaries.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Guess so. OK - I need to sign off for a bit - call me if things go south.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Will do. And thanks - you’ve given us a fighting chance.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: OK. Need to hustle to F.E.A.S.T.’s Sister Site in Harlem and help May.

Speaker: MJ
Text: Peter! Thank god - we need you at the Veteran’s Center - where are you?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I got held up - are you OK? What’s happening?

Speaker: MJ
Text: The convicts started a fire! We got the building staff out, but May and Miles are trapped inside. I’m trying to find a way in to them but the fire’s spreading so fast…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Stay where you are, MJ. I’ll handle this. Damn it - move it Pete - move!

Speaker: MJ
Text: Peter! Fire and rescue’s on the way, and I found a fire escape that’ll get me -

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: MJ, stay back! Don’t want to have to rescue you too -

Speaker: MJ
Text: Peter don’t be crazy want for help!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: May? MAY!

Speaker: Miles
Text: Help! Here! We’re over here! I’ve got you…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hang on!

Speaker: Miles
Text: Aunt May you all right?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Get to the window!

Speaker: Miles
Text: It’s too far!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hold on.
