Speaker: MJ
Text: Just… Brace yourselves!
[She is trying to knock down a half-broken beam.]

Speaker: MJ
Text: Come on you stupid piece of - Come on - May - I’ve got you!

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: Oh my god…

Speaker: MJ
Text: Miles, come on! We’ve got you!
[On the roof…]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Is May… OK?

Speaker: MJ
Text: Everyone’s safe.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: MJ. If it weren’t for you and Miles. I would’ve been -

Speaker: MJ
Text: -as dead as I would’ve been 8 ½ thousand times you saved me. Pretty sure I still owe you a few.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Heh -- Oww… That’s smart…

Speaker: MJ
Text: Hey. I’m sorry I screwed things up. It’s just… hard being the one who always gets saved, you know? Sometimes I want to do the saving.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I’m sorry I made you feel like you couldn’t. Still partners?

Speaker: MJ
Text: Always.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Hey… uh, so I didn’t know if, uh, you wanted sparkling, or flat or spring or mountain spring so I got one of each. Am I… interrupting?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: No. Um. MJ - Ms. Watson and I were just talking strategy.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Strategy?

Speaker: MJ
Text: That’s right. The city’s in danger. It needs our help.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: *All* of our help.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Alright well. Call the play, coach.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: OK. Divide and conquer. Ms. Watson - we need an antiserum for Devil’s Breath. Oscorp’s developing something, but there’s no way they can keep it safe from Octavius and Li. We need to fund the cure, and protect it. Miles - you need to be my eyes and ears at F.E.A.S.T. Anything goes wrong, call me. We need to keep that place and the people there safe.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Alright, you’ve got it… what are you gonna do?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: A gang of costumed nut-jobs is taking the city apart piece by piece. Time I return the favour.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Alright… Hey wait - um, how do I call you? I mean do you have like, a cellphone in your… .in your pockets, or something?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Ms. Watson can give you my number. Good luck, team.

Speaker: Miles
Text: You have his number… are you… Spider-Man’s girlfriend? That would be so cool if-

Speaker: MJ
Text: Come on, Sherlock. Show me what you’ve got in this water smorgasbord…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: City feels a *little* more under control… Miles is watching F.E.A.S.T MJ is tracking a Devil’s Breath cure… Time for me to focus on funding Otto, and stopping whatever he has planned. Yuri. we need to start tracking the big boys. Still no leads on Octavius?

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: No, nothing. Forensics can’t even do a sweep of Times Square - everyone in that department but the intern is sick.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I might be able to turn something up; let you know what I find.
[He swings to Time Square.]

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: Spider-Man - here to lend a hand?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Thought you might need one officer.

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: You don’t know the half of it - never seen anything like this Devil’s Breath stuff. Forensics is havin’ a hell of a time.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: News reports say this is where Otto released Devil’s Breath… might’ve left some residue I can track… Hmm some residue on this sign. Maybe I can isolate it. AT-rich leader sequence… this looks promising. Oscorp’s modified Cpf1. Definitely Devil’s Breath. Should be able to track the dispersal path now… Trail goes in a few directions; need to find the right one.

Speaker: Man on the street
Text: How long’s it gonna be closed for?

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: Really can’t say, sir.

Speaker: Man
Text: Freakin’ spooky in there.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: No good; dead end.

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: Spider-Man, hey!

Speaker: Police Officer
Text: You get that crazy octopus guy who did this, you hear me?

Speaker: Police Officer 2
Text: You here when it happened?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Vapour trail heads up that building… Trail jumps between these buildings… Trail leads down into those vents… what was Otto doing up here? Should be a door or an access hatch around here…
[He find Octavius’ secret hideout.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Well this is moody… Must be some way to hit the lights… Let there be light… whoa. Was Otto using this as a staging ground? Chaos of the prison break would’ve been perfect cover to move in.
[He listens to a voice recorder on a table with blueprints and Norman Osborne posters.]

Speaker: Otto
Text: Norman. Feel like I can’t turn around without seeing his face. He smiles for the cameras, collects his accolades… and keeps his boat heel pressed against my neck. Why can’t anyone else see how selfish he is? How reckless? How… evil? If only they could be made to see the Norman I know… the man behind the mask…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Looks like Otto’s been studying Sable’s tech for weaknesses. Good ol’ Rhino. My second favourite Russian. Looks like Otto recorded messages for his crew…

Speaker: Otto
Text: Aleksei. I’ve followed your career with great interest. The world sees you as a witless dullard; I see a warrior with a poet’s heart. I know you desire freedom from the battle suit you’re sealed inside. Help me achieve my goals, and freedom shall be yours.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Mac Gargan AKA Scorpion AKA Crazy Pants McCrazy.

Speaker: Otto
Text: It’s rare for me to admit this Mr. Gargan -- clearing your debts was more difficult than I anticipated. You are in arrears to some… demanding individuals. Once the reservoir job is finished, your financial obligations will be finished as well. Otto Octavius is nothing if not persuasive.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Old man Vulture… I’ve tangled with him more than anyone else here…

Speaker: Otto
Text: Adrian, what bitter irony that your miraculous Wings should have wrought such horrors on your body. Thankfully, you are now working for me. When our work is settled, the treatment I’ve developed *will* cure you. You won’t shuffle off this mortal coil just yet, my friend.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Electro. Total live wire, that one.

Speaker: Otto
Text: Max. When you first conveyed your dream to me I thought you insane. But as I dove deeper into the problem. I discovered a way to give us both what we desire. I promise you, when we are done, you *will* be pure energy. Or so close to it as to make the difference irrelevant.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: What’s this now… Otto must’ve used this map to plan, but it’s blank… unless there’s something here I’m missing… Otto’s rage is driving him. The neural interface is exacerbating it… but his hate is genuine. He’ll destroy the whole city to hurt Norman… Martin Li… can’t believe this is the same man I knew at F.E.A.S.T…

Speaker: Otto
Text: Oh Martin. When I first realised it was you targeting Osborn these past weeks I was shocked and saddened. But then, as the situation evolved before my eyes I felt inspired. You took the bold steps I had always dreamed of, Martin, and you took them without hesitation. I am honoured now to jam you on this path towards true justice.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Seems like Otto and Li have more of a history than I thought… how long have they known each other? U.V. bulb… Hmm nothing happened. Must be a way to get that lamp on… There we go. Hidden markings. Otto’s tasked the villains to destroy Oscorp holdings throughout the city… he’s trying to take apart Norman’s empire piece by piece… Li’s going after the Devil’s Breath antiserum using something called Icarus? Scorpion must be trying to prison the city’s reservoir… another Oscorp-owned property Rhino‘s targeting Oscorp’s shoreline properties… which is he hitting first, and why? Electro’s disabling Oscorp power plants… makes sense. What’s Vulture doing in Times Square? Need to keep my guard up… Seems like the last stage of the plan is a direct assault on Oscorp… and, most likely, Norman… “Icarus” - this is it.
[He open a suitcase. There’s a screen in it.]

Speaker: Otto
Text: Hello, Spider-Man. We’ve never been properly introduced. I’m -

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Otto Octavius. There is no “Icarus” is there?

Speaker: Otto
Text: No. Martin needs no assistance to secure the antiserum. “Icarus” was a ruse to get you into position.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Into position…?
[There is a bomb inside the case. Spidey quickly jumps out of the building through ventilation shaft, but gets in the claws of the Vulture.]

Speaker: Vulture
Text: Need a lift? So refreshing to work for a man like Octavius! Backup plans for his backup plans!
[He drags Spidey through the city. MJ suddenly calls.]

Speaker: MJ
Text: Pete? Are you OK? What’s happening?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Traffic’s rough. Listen: Li’s gunning for the antiserum. We need to find Oscorp’s Devil’s Breath lab before he does.

Speaker: MJ
Text: On it right now. I’m pulling every building permit in the city - if there’s a record of the lab, I’ll find it.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: That’s great! OK - ugh - talk soon, MJ.

Speaker: Electro
Text: Trap failed?

Speaker: Vulture
Text: Softened him up. Time for Plan B.
[Spidey forced to fight with both Electro and Vulture. Epic air battle begins.]

Speaker: Electro
Text: Teamwork’s beautiful, ain‘t it? Helpin’ ya reach those unattainable goals - like killin’ Spider-Man!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: That was almost heart-warming. Electro. You really grew in prison, didn’t you? Missed me, missed me, now you gotta - y’know what, forget I said anything. He’s stunned-- now’s my chance! Need to web the transformer he’s over.

Speaker: Electro
Text: Argh – V! You’re up!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yo Adrian - it’s me, Spider-Man!

Speaker: Vulture
Text: What are you babbling about?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Nobody ever gets my jokes.

Speaker: Vulture
Text: Our long feud ends tonight, insect.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Feud? Thought we had a healthy give-and-take. Man have I misread this relationship.

Speaker: Vulture
Text: Looks like that hurt!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Need to get him to drop his guard first.

Speaker: Vulture
Text: Nothing more than luck… You won’t do that again!

Speaker: Electro
Text: Spider-Man - I must break you.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: You got it! You got my joke! I’m so happy I could almost stop fighting! Almost! Gotta be honest: liked it better when you two were loners.

Speaker: Electro
Text: Amazing what a little teamwork can achieve, ain’t it?

Speaker: Vulture
Text: The Vigour of youth, the Wisdom of experience. A fine pairing.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: He’s disabled: now’s my chance. Just like oil and water. Sure.

Speaker: Vulture
Text: Looks like that hurt! He doesn’t stand a chance.

Speaker: Electro
Text: Yeah, yeah - we got this!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Again, hate to be the pessimist, but I don’t think you guys are assessing this situation accurately.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: One down, one to go. How many times have we done this dance. Adrian? A dozen? Two dozen?

Speaker: Vulture
Text: Once too many. Tonight will be your last waltz. Nothing more than luck… Next time you’re mine! You won’t do that again!
[Spidey defeat them. The police comes.]

Speaker: Otto
Text: What’s happening?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Electro’s been grounded.

Speaker: Otto
Text: Spider-Man, I presume? If you really cared about this city you’d be helping me expose Osborn for the criminal he is!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: By killing innocent people?

Speaker: Otto
Text: I would’ve restored the power!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: You’re sick. You need help.

Speaker: Otto
Text: I have all the help I need. And we are not stop until Norman gets that he deserves.
[Spidey swings away to some building.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hate it when they team up. Just need to catch my breath…
[He falls asleep till the morning comes.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: What time… oh man. Need to update Yuri… Yuri. Vulture and Electro are down; four to go.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: I saw - also noticed a rooftop in Times Square exploded. Wouldn’t happen to be related, would it?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Nothing gets by you. It was Octavius’ staging ground - he’s using the villains to pull apart Oscorp. Vulture and Electro were targeting power plants. Scorpion’s going after water treatment. Not sure about Rhino yet, something along the shoreline.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: That’s good enough to start. I assume you’re going after Scorpion?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yeah ,city’s already on the brink. If we lose clean water, we might never come back. I’ll update you when I make progress.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Sounds like a plan.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I should check on Miles.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Hey, Pete. You okay?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: That’s what I was gonna ask you. I’m fine, but you and May are in the middle of it.

Speaker: Miles
Text: We’re busy, but people need help. And I’d rather be doing something than waiting around for somebody else to fix things, y’know?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yeah. I heard that. Just make sure you protect yourself - mask and gloves. And rest every now and then. All that goes double for May.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Nobody can make that woman take a break when she doesn’t want to. But I’ll do my best.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Thanks, Miles. Give May my love… and be safe.
[Spidey arrive to the place in Central Park.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: There’s the reservoir… but no sign of Scorpion. Better take a closer look. If I was a mercenary dressed like a scorpion, where would I be…

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Behind you.
[They have a short fight during that Scorpion stings Spidey with his tail.]

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Me, I’d end it now. But Octavius is paying, and he wants to torture you… which I respect.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Damn it… what did he inject me with?
[Scorpio leaves. Spidey begins to hallucinate. He urgently needs an antidote.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Whoa… what the… Is that… a sea of poison? Can’t be… This can’t be real… must be the poison… but I can’t take any chances… Gotta get to higher ground, then analyse whatever he injected me with. Okay, should be safe for a minute. Need to analyse the neurotoxin so I can create an antidote. Scorpion’s made some upgrades. Hallucinogenic neurotoxin… my brains create nightmares that my body thinks are real. I have to create the antidote, fast. First I need a natural steroid extract from an eclipta alba plant should do the trick. ESU’s greenhouse is nearby. Hope it’s in season… There’s the greenhouse! Eclipta alba should be inside the greenhouse… There it is. Huh? Where’d it go? Is this real or in my mind?

Speaker: Otto
Text: It can be both.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Doc?

Speaker: Otto
Text: It’s just the hallucinations intensifying. You can get through this.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Doc? Y-you sound…

Speaker: Otto
Text: Like I did before the neural interface affected my mind. My obsessions were always there, but the interface allowed me to fully embrace them.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I have to fix this. Fix you. Somehow.

Speaker: Otto
Text: Ah, Peter, always trying to shoulder the responsibility, even when there’s no hope. I can’t tell you how many times your unfettered optimism has kept me going when things looked bleak. I’ll miss being with you, I really will.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I’m sorry, Doc. I’m so sorry.

Speaker: Otto
Text: Yes, yes. You’re sorry, and yet you let it happen. Makes one wonder where your priorities lie. I mean, if I was really that important to you, why would you let me destroy myself?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I can help you it’s the neural web, it’s affecting your mind.

Speaker: Otto
Text: You mean the neural web you helped create. The hard truth is *you* did this to me. Without your help, I would have never done any of those terrible things.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I… should’ve seen what was happening to you…. There’s the eclipta alba… WHAAAH! The plants buy me time, but I need an antitoxin to mix a permanent antidote. One of Harry’s research stations was developing a synthetic atropine gotta get there fast. Giant deadly scorpion tails… lovely. Thanks, brain.

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: How you feeling, spider? Raw panic crawling up your spine?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Scorpion?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: How’d you get this number?

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Always asking the least interesting questions. It’s “not how’m I calling you?” it’s “*am* I calling you”? Maybe I’m just the favored screams of your dying brain…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Real or no, when I cure this poison. I’m coming for you, Mac.

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Hahaha! Big talk from the little bug. Have fun chasing pink elephants.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I don’t even want to know what Freud would make of those. There‘s the research station. Need that atropine-- Atropine’s right there… Atropine’s gone… Not again…

Speaker: Otto
Text: You’re too late. Just as you were too late to help me.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: This isn’t you, Doc!

Speaker: Otto
Text: You’re too late. Just as you were too late to help me.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: This isn’t you. Doc!

Speaker: Otto
Text: Ah, but it IS me. The “me” polite society found inconvenient. The parts of myself I suppressed. But you helped me break those chains!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I-I’m sorry… I’ll find a way to help you. I swear it!

Speaker: Otto
Text: Stop deluding yourself. You never help anyone. The poison isn’t in you - you ARE the poison! Everyone you touch suffers.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Stop running from me! Let me try!

Speaker: Otto
Text: I want nothing from you. You’re a failure! At life, love, career! You bring nothing but pain!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: No, stop! I’m not giving up on you! Please. Just talk to me - I can help you!

Speaker: Otto
Text: So you can treat me like all the rest - containing me? Suffocating me? I will let my genius shine on its own! I saw you, Peter. Taking notes. Stealing ideas - a rat in my own lab.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: There it is… the atropine. WHAAAH! Got the atropine. Now I just need to mix up the antidote. Looks like I’m headed back to the lab.

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Still with us?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: And nearly cured. Sorry to bust up your plans.

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Oh webs, don’t worry. Plenty of surprises left for you. We’ll be seeing each other again real Scorpion soon.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Count on it.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: M-made it… somehow. But I’m running out of time… I need to mix the antidote. Finally… AARRGH!

Speaker: Doc Ock
Text: I think not. You’re in my domain now. You’re just like Osborn! Trying to steal my genius! Everything that happens now is your fault! I knew you were laughing at me! All of you, behind my back!

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Thought I forgot about you?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Scorpion? Are you even real?

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Hold still. I’ll show you.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: When he stops, maybe I can hit him. That gave me an opening. Another hallucination. At least he had an imaginary glass jaw.

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Not gonna be that easy!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Sure it is. Now I know you’re the poison trying to distract me. Bring it on When he stops, maybe I can hit him. One down. Can’t let him get to me. Got him. The world would be better off Without you. And you know it! Nice. Just a few more left. Another one down.

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Some hero. Everyone you ever met suffers.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: It’s like fighting internet trolls: knock one down, another pops up. One more…

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: If I was your uncle. I would’ve jumped in front of a bullet too!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: My inner voice has really developed an attitude. He’s hard to hit when he’s moving. Hope that’s the last of ‘em… I can barely stand up. There’s the equipment I need. Finally… I’m running out of time. I’m running out of time I can feel it. I think I did it…
[He makes the antidote and returns to the real world.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Where’d my suit go? I think I took decontamination a little too far. Better put some clothes on… Much better. Let’s just go ahead and forget that ever happened.
[He leaves Octavius’ lab and swings to the city.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Head’s still foggy. Need to work the last of this poison out of my system before I tackle the other villains. Good time to go on patrol. MJ hey. You mind if I toss a kinda thorny ethical question at you? When is it OK to give up on a friend?

Speaker: MJ
Text: Oh wow, Pete. Thinking of Otto?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: That obvious, huh?

Speaker: MJ
Text: Yeah; understandable though. Man… the high minded, generous part of me wants to say “never” - being a true friend means being there, even when people lose their way… but with what Otto’s done… I just don’t know Pete. I guess you have to decide if the Otto Octavius you knew is still in there or not… maybe if he was ever even in there at all…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yeah… yeah. Thanks MJ. I gotta process some stuff. I think.

Speaker: MJ
Text: Call me any time Pete. I’m here for you.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: OK. I need to get after Scorpion but… I haven’t seen Aunt May face to face since the fire. Think I can afford a quick pit stop at F.E.A.S.T.
[He swings to F.E.A.S.T. saving the city in the process.]

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: Right over here - until Miles gets back, the best thing we can do is keep everyone fed… Oh Peter! It is so good to see you. How are you - healthy?

Speaker: Peter
Text: I’m good, how are you holding up, May?

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: Good, but busy-

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: Oh! Let me g- (bends in pain]

Speaker: Peter
Text: Whoa there.

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: I’m okay.

Speaker: Peter
Text: Didn’t you tell me something once about accepting that I’m human, just like everyone else?

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: You and Ben. Masters at turning my own words against me. I’m fine, Peter. Just a little rundown.

Speaker: Peter
Text: Where’s Miles? Could he help out?

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: He’s off picking up medical supplies from the relief centre. It’s amazing how quickly we go through antibiotics.

Speaker: Peter
Text: You stay off your feet for a bit I’ll organize the unloading and check in with Miles deal?

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: Deal. Give me a chance to nurse my wounded Parker pride.

Speaker: Peter
Text: Come on Miles – answer. Don’t make me worry about you AND May…
[In the meantime, Miles will hide behind the boxes on the street full of criminals. He quickly turns off the phone.]

Speaker: Miles
Text: Quiet… quiet. So much for “a milk run”… How did a bunch of convicts even do this? Looks like an exploding bulldozer went through here… Can’t turn back… F.E.A.S.T, needs those antibiotics…

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: You hear the sound his head made when the big guy hit him?

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Need something to smash…

Speaker: Miles
Text: Need to distract him… Hacking app should work…

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Heard something.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Time to move.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Must’ve imagined it.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Should be able to hop that wall… Medical container’s in that tent; maybe this’ll be easy.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: You see the way he came through here?

Speaker: Miles
Text: Gauze…

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Nada.

Speaker: Miles
Text: iodine…

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Guess I’m hearing things…

Speaker: Miles
Text: …but no antibiotics. Need to keep looking.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Both of ‘em are. Glad they’re on our side.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: This is my kind of gentrification.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: You two! Get over here.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Alright alright already.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Who’s there?

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: This can stop right now. Just give us the locations and schedules for your supply runs.

Speaker: Miles
Text: More supplies over here. Need to get past these guys.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Someone there?

Speaker: Sabre Agent
Text: I don’t have that infor-

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Believe me, I hate watchin’ Benson wall on ya. Turns my stomach.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Why’re the super dudes so set on takin’ out these relief centres?

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: The wind I guess.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Nada.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Somethin’ about Osborn. They wanna show how weak he is, that he can’t protect the city.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: I wish someone would make a move on us.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Getting antsy.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Sounds like a lotta drama. Long as they let us keep all the supplies we find, I don’t care.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Yeah man. This stuff’ll be worth a fortune on the black market.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Come on, let’s keep diggin’ through it.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Sable guys give up the depot locations?

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Eventually, yeah. Gotta lay off the coffee.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Now the big guy’s takin’ the stations out all by himself.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Dude’s a walkin’ a-bomb.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: It’s that Russian blood, man. Makes ‘im crazy.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: That’s offensive. My grandma’s Russian.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Your grandma? Doesn’t that mean you’re Russian too?

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: What… no… man don’t talk about my family, all right?

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Can’t afford to get spooked. What’s that?

Speaker: Miles
Text: Another supply tent. Crossing fingers. Couple trauma kits, but no antibiotics. Gotta be somewhere… Gotta avoid that sniper…

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Looks they’re gonna divvy up the supplies.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Ohhh boy.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: They better not try to short us.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Hey you guys better not try to short us!

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Bro, relax. Everybody gets a take. Nobody’s tryin’ to short you.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: That’s just what they say when they’re tryin’ to short you.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Dude, please don’t embarrass me. Chill. Please.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: I’m watchin’ these Jokers. Oh yeah. I’m watchin’ ‘em.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Gettin’ paranoid.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: I heard that!

Speaker: Miles
Text: More supplies… Come on crate, be the one… Amoxicillin. Perfect.
[Unexpectedly, an agent flew into the antibiotic cart and turns it over. A shootout begins. Miles sees a huge man in a gray suit, throwing agents like they are nothing.]

Speaker: Sabre Agent
Text: Reloading - cover me!

Speaker: Miles
Text: That is a very large man. Found the exploding bulldozer…

Speaker: Rhino
Text: Supply routes and schedules. Now.

Speaker: Rhino
Text: Ya skazal- (I said…]

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Gentlemen- I apologise. My associate is… Inelegant. He doesn’t understand the fine art of persuasion.
[He kills an agent.]

Speaker: Sable Agent
Text: STOP! We’ll talk. WE’LL TALK.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Did not need to see that…
[He picks up some antibiotics and tries to escape quietly.]

Speaker: Rhino
Text: What was that?

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Check it. Now.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Don’t think he saw me. Time to get outta here.

Speaker: Rhino
Text: Whoever is here, come out!

Speaker: Rhino
Text: I have not time for this.

Speaker: Miles
Text: That tunnel - maybe I can sneak beneath him…

Speaker: Rhino
Text: Come out small one… We are having fun with lights now? I will have fun with your face. Come out and I promise not to cruuush you.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Please don’t see me, please don’t see me…

Speaker: Rhino
Text: Where are you? Play no games with me.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Only way forward is right past him…

Speaker: Rhino
Text: You test my patience. Come out- NOW!

Speaker: Miles
Text: Wait for it…

Speaker: Rhino
Text: I do not need this…

Speaker: Miles
Text: Go!

Speaker: Rhino
Text: Where.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Whoa - close.

Speaker: Rhino
Text: Are.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Too close.

Speaker: Rhino
Text: YOU.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Gotta be getting close to the exit…

Speaker: Rhino
Text: No. More. GAMES! Where. Are. YOU!

Speaker: Miles
Text: Oh. Man. OK… I gotta get outta here.

Speaker: Rhino
Text: No. HIDING!

Speaker: Miles
Text: Maybe if I get up there I’ll be safe…

Speaker: Rhino
Text: When I find you I will CRUSH YOU!

Speaker: Miles
Text: There - that container. That’s my exit.

Speaker: Rhino
Text: You cannot HIDE!

Speaker: Miles
Text: Need to get him to clear the opening… Go go go.

Speaker: Rhino
Text: COME OUT!

Speaker: Miles
Text: Go go go.

Speaker: Rhino
Text: It is chase of goose. I hate chase of goose!!!
[Miles managed to escape.]

Speaker: Miles
Text: Should let May know I have these.
[He notices a few scumbags beating up a man.]

Speaker: Man
Text: Get off me!

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Just give us the wallet.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Give it ta us, man!
[Miles already wanted to turn around and leave…]

Speaker: Man
Text: Help!
[Miles is putting his whole will in the fist.]

Speaker: Miles
Text: Hey! Leave him alone!

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Big mistake, kid.

Speaker: Miles
Text: You can’t just push people around like that.

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Oh what, like this?
[Miles dodges the punch.]

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Ha! Kid’s got guts.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Alright… Hips squared…

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: The hell’s he saying?

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Not gonna say anything in a second-
[He’s trying to hit Miles, but he’s only getting his face punched.]

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Whoa.

Speaker: Miles
Text: You… want a taste?

Speaker: Prisoner
Text: Naw I’m good, kid.

Speaker: Miles
Text: “Want a taste?” I gotta work on my fight banter…
[Peter calls.]

Speaker: Peter
Text: Miles? Hey - I’ve been trying to reach you, you OK?

Speaker: Miles
Text: Hey. So uh… don’t freak out, but um… I got to fill you in on some stuff…
[We switching to Peter’s side…]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Incredible work, Miles. Stick close to F.E.A.S.T. - if the convicts get desperate, they may try to raid the shelter.

Speaker: Miles
Text: Way ahead of you. Anything else happens here, I’ll let you know.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Great - thanks Miles. Yuri. Figured out Rhino’s deal: he’s attacking Oscorp’s relief centres.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Think I know which one he’s hitting next: reports of a possible earthquake and/or demolition derby at the Harlem centre.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Sounds like our boy. Headed there now.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: You holding up OK?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Tired. But hanging in there.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: We’ll get through this. Keep the faith.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Hey MJ, what’s up - you OK?

Speaker: MJ
Text: I’m fine. Combing through Oscorp records. Hey, this is random but… you remember that trip we took to Staten island with Harry?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: To find the “best pizza in the city?” Yeah, ten hour odyssey for burnt toast with cold American cheese, how could I forget?

Speaker: MJ
Text: Something about all these old Oscorp files made that day pop into my head… Harry was so excited about riding the ferry just made me think about how much simpler things were back then. No jobs. No Super Villains. We could throw away a whole day looking for bad pizza just cause. Now it feels like if we take a nap, the world will fall apart.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Yeah. This adult thing is rough… but I guess the work we do means today’s kids can have their own Staten island adventures. In safety. Kind of a circle of life thing.

Speaker: MJ
Text: Circle of Bad Pizza. Yeah, you’re right. That’s a good way to look at it. Thanks Pete.
[Spidey swings to Harlem’s docks, there Rhino fights Sabre Agents.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Pick on someone your own size, Rhino.

Speaker: Rhino
Text: There is no one my size, pauk .

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Or maybe we could just… talk it out? Rhino, what’s with the team up? Thought you were a loner.

Speaker: Rhino
Text: Means and ends, pauk . All of life is means and ends.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: So what’s the end for these particular means?

Speaker: Rhino
Text: Freedom! True freedom. No more suit. No more “Rhino.”

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Aww. I always liked the suit. So distinctive.

Speaker: Rhino
Text: Be thankful, pauk . Without suit I make less trouble for you.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: But what about our stimulating battle-side chats?

Speaker: Rhino
Text: You are funny, malen’kiy . I am almost sorry to destroy your tiny face. Almost.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: OK Rhino. Let’s wrap this-

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Never send an 8 ton infant to do a man’s job - let’s finish this.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Aw, Scorps, love ya but you do know it’s rude to cut in, right?

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: What were you gonna do if I didn’t show up? Beg him to give up?

Speaker: Rhino
Text: Yes Gargan. That is exactly what I would have done.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Aww. Like an old married couple, you two.

Speaker: Rhino
Text: Move it Gargan!

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Stupid OAF!

Speaker: Rhino
Text: YOU are in MY way!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: So you guys and Octavius, you have a name yet? The Scary Six? The Dirty Half Dozen?

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: How about the “We Murdered Spider-Man and Used His Corpse For a Blanket” Six?

Speaker: Rhino
Text: Gargan… please. You embarrass yourself. Gargan! What are you doing?

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Get him, you idiot!

Speaker: Rhino
Text: “Get him?” Come down and help, durak .

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Guys, please. There’s plenty of me to go around.

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: How did you not see that coming?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Rhino’s getting his suit removed… what did Octavius promise you, Scorpion?

Speaker: Rhino
Text: Money. Gargan has no principles. He fights for profit.

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Untrue. I’d rip Spider-Man’s face off for free. The money’s a bonus.

Speaker: Rhino
Text: Pathetic, Gargan. I will squash the bug myself.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: We could just stop now, you know. I won’t tell anybody.

Speaker: Rhino
Text: And leave your skull un-crushed? Where is fun in that? Come here, pauk . I will teach you to throw real punch.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: My jaw’s already absorbed that particular lesson, thanks.

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Do you know what Octavius’ll do if he finds out you failed???

Speaker: Rhino
Text: I failed?

Speaker: Scorpion
Text: Yes, you, freak show!

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Didn’t I hear you took a poetry class in The Raft? Like a therapy thing?
[They’re starting to fight. Spidey dumps them in a container and seals it with his web.]

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: A little forced together time might help you boys learn to play nice. All right Yuri, that’s four down. Just Octavius and Li left.

Speaker: Yuri Watanabe
Text: Something tells me they won’t be as easy. They’re only half of our problem though. Devil’s Breath cases are getting worse, and Oscorp is being coy about an antiserum. I’m worried they’re seeing dollar signs in a seller’s market.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I’d expect nothing less from our beloved Mayor. Leave Devil’s Breath to me, one of my best people’s on it.

Speaker: MJ
Text: Pete, hey. I’ve been through city, state and federal databases - if this Devil’s Breath lab does exist, it’s off the books. The only other place I can think to look is in Norman’s personal files.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I’ve already been through his office computer… are you thinking his penthouse? That building’s full of Sable’s men. If they spot me, other residents could get hurt in a fire fight.

Text: Not more than it means to me. Can’t you see all the people you’re hurting?!

Speaker: Otto
Text: You’ll never understand. You haven’t suffered like I have… You should be on my side!

Speaker: Peter
Text: I was…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Please… think of the man you were…

Speaker: Otto
Text: That man is gone. You can’t ‘save’ me, Peter.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Then I guess you’ll have to save yourself.

Speaker: Peter
Text: You were my hero! You meant so much to me… I hate that you’re making me do this! We were going to change the world!

Speaker: Otto
Text: You look tired, Parker.

Speaker: Peter
Text: Not tired. Just hurt. Otto! Stop!

Speaker: Otto
Text: Oh, Parker. If you want to change the world… you have to be the kind of man who can make the hardest decisions.

Speaker: Peter
Text: I couldn’t… agree… *MORE*! AAAARGHHH!!

Speaker: Otto
Text: AAHH! NOOOO!
[Otto falls from the roof.]

Speaker: Peter
Text: The antiserum…
[He catch Otto and jumps with him into some kind of maintenance room.]

Speaker: Otto
Text: AAGHH! Peter. I saw you as a son. I should’ve known you’d turn on me, just like all the others.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Turn-?  I worshipped you! Your mind… your conscience, wanting to help others… the way you never gave up!

Speaker: Otto
Text: That’s because men like us have a duty. A responsibility. To use our talents in the service of others. Even if they don’t appreciate it… we have to do what’s best for those beneath us. Whether they understand it or not.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: No. You’re wrong. You were everything I wanted to be! You just… threw it away’

Speaker: Otto
Text: Yes, of course. You’re right, Peter. The neural interface affected my mind. But I can fix it. We can fix it… together. If you’ll help me.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I’ll do everything I can. I’ll make sure you get the best help--

Speaker: Otto
Text: No! If they put me away, they’ll take my arms! I’ll be trapped in this *useless* body! Please, Peter. That… wasn’t me. You said you’d never abandon me, you promised, remember? And, of course… you’ll rest easy knowing your secret is safe with me.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: You do what you think is best, Doc. It’s all any of us can.

Speaker: Otto
Text: Peter-?

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: Even when it hurts like hell.

Speaker: Otto
Text: Peter? Where are you going? Peter! PETER!!
[Meanwhile at F.E.A.S.T. Dr Michaels is studying the antiserum. Aunt May laying in bed near him.]

Speaker: Dr. Michaels
Text: It’s still viable-- but we’ll need the entire sample as a base to produce more doses.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: How long will that take?

Speaker: Dr. Michaels
Text: Few hours maybe a day.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: What if we use it to cure someone right now?

Speaker: Dr. Michaels
Text: Then there won’t be enough to cure the others. I’ll give you a few minutes.

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: You’re going to be okay, ma’am. I’ve got the cure right here.

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: Take off your mask. I want to see my nephew.

Speaker: Peter
Text: You knew?

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: I’ve known for a while.

Speaker: Peter
Text: I never wanted you to worry.

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: I did.

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: And I am so proud of you. And Ben would be too. All the people you’ve saved…

Speaker: Spider-Man
Text: I don’t know what to do…

Speaker: Aunt May
Text: Yes you do.

Text: Congrats! I knew you could do it.

Text: Yeah. I think I might want to become a chef.

Text: I’m sorry. No. It’s -- you’re a scientist. A good one.

Text: The last project I worked on I created a monster octopus that almost destroyed the city. So…

Text: Yea. I mean, you do make a hell of a chicken curry.

Text: I do-- Still working on my dumplings though.

Text: Going camping?

Text: Oh… my new place isn’t going to be ready for about a week, so I’m going to be crashing with Miles for the next few nights.

Speaker: MJ
Text: Oh, you know, you can always stay at my place. Only if you want to.

Speaker: Peter
Text: No. I mean yes! I mean, no I don’t *not* want to, meaning I *do* want to… Only if you do.

Speaker: MJ
Text: I never stopped wanting to.

Speaker: Peter
Text: Me neither.

Text: Well I’m not an expert or anything, but I think it’s in the way that you ask her.

Text: I think I’m too nervous. Alright, so where do you want this?
